comments:
POCSO supersedes it. 

All sexual acts with children under the age of 18 is a sexual offense.

I do not understand what alarms you. 

This decriminalizes marital rape for spouses above 15.
It was modified in 2017 to 18 to align with 18 as legal age of consent. 

Non-consensual sexual interaction between spouses is not considered as rape if the victim is above 18. Until 2017 it used to be 15. 

However,

Any kind of sexual activity with a person under the age of 18 is a sexual offence. It has been so since the POCSO Act of 2012. 

And, what would constite a marital rape constitutes domestic abuse in the current legal framework which is a civil offense and not a criminal one.

I wasn't alarmed but the below 3 points are pretty scandalous...

Thanks for the explanation anyway. 

1. This decriminalizes marital rape for spouses above 15.
It was modified in 2017 to 18 to align with 18 as legal age of consent. 

2. Non-consensual sexual interaction between spouses is not considered as rape if the victim is above 18. Until 2017 it used to be 15. 

3. And, what would constite a marital rape constitutes domestic abuse in the current legal framework which is a civil offense and not a criminal one.

Yes.

Child abuse laws were nearly absent till 2003. Later too it didn‚Äôt protect non-female victims. 

And rape was restricted to vagino-penal intercourse only. Non-vagino-penal, non-consensual intercourse would have been Unnatural Sex + Physical Assault and not Rape. 

Hopefully the new penal code is properly streamlined, including all new acts that supersede the relevant sections of IPC.
